intro: Conchophyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny, leaf structures and showy, daisy-like flowers. These plants are typically found in coastal areas, where they thrive in salty, sandy environments. Conchophyllum species are known for their ability to tolerate harsh maritime conditions. Their botanical features make them an important part of coastal ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
